shot: Macro push-in through an exploded lens stack blueprint that assembles into a living biomechanical eye.
subject: A cybernetic ocular assembly: floating glass elements wireframe schematics and a human eye with metallic micro-iris and filament lashes.

scene.environment: Black void with faint blueprint gridlines and technical wireframes soft volumetric dust motes.
scene.lighting: Cool rim and top light with specular highlights on glass subtle cyan emissive lines tracing the schematics faint subsurface glow in the sclera.

visual_details.beat: Exploded lens stack hangs in space. Wireframe rings pulse on labeling contours no text. Micro-springs and screws drift constrained to rails.
visual_details.action: Camera begins slow dolly forward along optical axis shallow DOF reveals front element sharp background eye soft.

visual_details.beat: Elements magnetically align. Each lens snaps into place with tiny shimmer and refractive flare iris blades unfold like a mechanical flower.
visual_details.action: Camera continues single forward push focus racks from front element to mid stack to iris.

visual_details.beat: Blueprint lines wrap the human eye converting from wireframe to organic detail. Final click: lens seats over cornea iris blinks once. A concentric wave ripples outward.
visual_details.action: Camera completes push-in to extreme macro of the pupil end on locked steady close-up.
